page.title: 05AYLSHAM GROWERS
page.content: In this area many farmers have become involved with growing peas and beans on contract for Aylsham Growers. In 1969 Aylsham District Pea Growers expanded to grow and harvest peas for Ross Foods.Over the next few years the organisation grew and in 1984-3,800acres of peas,3,300acres of dwarf beans,1,672acres of broad beans and 154acres of sprouts were grown on contract to this company which is now called Aylsham Growers Ltd. The farmers drill the peas themselves and look after thecrop, then it is harvested by the large viners.Farmers release their men to work on the viners which work 24hours a day from early July to around September.The company also has alarge grain storage facility on the new Industrial estate at Aylsham.
